summary: "The Scarlet Letter" is a historical fiction book by Nathaniel Hawthorne, published in 1850. Set in the 1600s in Puritan Massachusetts, it tells the story of Hester Prynne, who has a child with a man she's not married to. As punishment, she must wear a scarlet 'A' for adultery. Hester tries to rebuild her life with dignity. The book explores themes of sin, guilt, and strict religious rules. It was one of the first mass-produced books in the U.S. and is now considered a classic American novel, inspiring many movies and adaptations.
title: The Scarlet Letter
